title: Women’s Tennis Association Is Helping Players Go Back to School
text:
In the summer of 2011, Venus Williams was gearing up for a comeback at the U.S. Open after a nagging hip injury derailed her game at the previous two majors. Off the court, she was preparing to relaunch EleVen, her athleisure clothing line, after a brief hiatus.

In the downtime she spent rehabbing her hip in July and early August, she realized she craved a deeper understanding of the business world and wanted to earn a bachelor’s degree. That’s how she discovered Indiana University East, a school of about 3,200 students in...
description: Since IU East’s online degree program came into being in 2013, nine women tennis pros have graduated, including Venus Williams and Sloane Stephens.
